input_text:
Job Title: Medical Collector (140976)

Location: Lithia, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Our client, a growing and specialized Medical Group, is seeking a Medical Collector to join their growing Accounts Receivable and Revenue Cycle Department. This role is a quintessential people person who loves coming up with new ideas, has a customer service approach, and is goal oriented.

Salary/Hourly Rate

$19 â€“ $23/hr

Position Overview

This Medical Collector will be joining the cohesive Revenue Cycle team, reporting directly to the Manager, and responsible for complete collections process, mainly insurance based. This is an extraordinary opportunity for a Medical Collector professional to jump start their career with a growing and developing firm here in Tampa Bay.

Responsibilities Of The Medical Collector

 Monitor accounts to identify outstanding debts. Responsible for a minimum of 35 claims per day Performs follow-up activities in a timely manner on all accounts to ensure prompt payment Identifies coding or billing problems from EOBs and works to correct the errors in a timely manner. Review denials as they come in to monitor trends Prepares accounts for rebilling and filing of secondary insurance; sends to carrier with necessary documents, as needed Completes and files appeals to different payers for the center for short payments and/or denials Updates the patient account record to identify actions taken on the account Investigate historical data for each debt or bill Find and contact patients to ask about their overdue payments Take actions to encourage timely debt payments Assist with payment posting and refunds Resolve billing and customer credit issues Update account status records and collection efforts Report on collection activity and accounts receivable status

Qualifications For The Medical Collector

 Minimum 2+ years of experience in Medical Collections (Insurance Collections) Working experience with denial management, appeals and ICD-10 is required Proficient in Excel (v-lookups, pivot tables, and formulas) Strong written and verbal communication skills Team player mentality Positive and willingness to help Ambitious and eager to grow with the company

Education Requirements

 Associates degree or higher is preferred but not required

Benefits

 Medical, Dental, and Vision 401k Plan

 As a woman-owned firm, we value diversity. We are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation and gender identity), age, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, veteran status, disability (physical or mental), genetic information, citizenship or any other characteristic protected by law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Candidates who apply for roles through the Atrium website will be added to our candidate pool and may be considered for additional roles of a similar title. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

EOE/M/F/D/V/SO 

Position ID: 140976

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
